Posts.Content: amyrn129 wrote: I had surgery 12/18/18 at Hospital of the University of Penn...I’m 3 weeks post op...I’m sore, I’m swollen-I CANNOT wear a bra I’m sooooo sensitive. I chose free tram flap reconstruction because I was a little nervyabout implants. My “foobs” are hard and look weird. I was a full double D my whole life and I think I’m a B now. I’m frustrated that I’m so sore I’m frustrated that my boobs look ugly I’m frustrated and I want my body back I still can’t drive. I’m a nurse and I’m praying I can go back to work in 3 more weeks (6 weeks off). Anyone out there go through this kind of surgery? Does this weird under arm swelling go away? Will my foobs ever feel like normal soft boobs again??? Dx 10/31/2018, IDC, Right, <1cm, Grade 1, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 12/7/2018 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Post op bilateral mastectomy w/free flap reconstruction amyrn129 amyrn129

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2019 05:51PM amyrn129 wrote: Thank you! May I ask, why no massage of the tissue now in the beginning??? I am taking Gabapentin. They increased my dose to 600mh every 8 hours and it has helped. I guess I’m at that three week annoyed phase you mentioned. I want this last of my six drains OUT! I just want to start feeling better. I’m poor because I’m on leave from work as a nurse and I still haven’t gotten a disability check so I can’t pay bills. Thank his gor thd meal train my coworker created it else I don’t know what I would be doing to feed my family of 5....Thank you for your reply! I’m seeing oncology tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Post op bilateral mastectomy w/free flap reconstruction amyrn129 amyrn129
